text.0: i was the first possessor of all precious gear the wealth of every man i win and gather up.
text.1: on me as on a father living creatures call i deal enjoyment to tho man who offers gifts.
text.2: i indra am atharvans stay and firm support i brought forth kine to trita from the dragons grasp.
text.3: i stripped the dasyus of their manly might and gave the cattlestalls to matarigvan and dadhyac.
text.4: for me hath tvaṣṭar forged the iron thunderbolt in me the gods have centred intellectual power.
text.5: my sheen is like the suns insufferably bright men honour me as lord for past and future deeds.
text.6: i won myself these herdi of cattle steeds and kine and gold in ample store with my destructive bolt.
text.7: i give full many a thousand to the worshipper what time the somas and the lauds have made me glad.
text.8: indra am i none ever wins my wealth from me never at any time am i a thrall to death.
text.9: pressing the soma ask riches from me alone ye pūrus in my friendship shall not suffer harm.
text.10: these breathing loud in fury two and two who caused indra to bring his bolt of thunder to the fray.
text.11: the challengers i struck with deadly weapon down firm stand what words the god speaks to his worshippers.
text.12: this one by stronger might i conquered singly yea also two shall three prevail against me.
text.13: like many sheaves upon the floor i thrash them how can my foes the indraless revile me.
text.14: against the gungus i made atithigva strong and kept him mid the folk like vṛtraconquering strength.
text.15: when i won glory in the great foeslaying fight in battle where karanja fell and parṇaya.
text.16: with food for mine enjoyment sapya nami came he joined me as a friend of old in search of kine.
text.17: as i bestowed on him an arrow for the fight i made him worthy of the song apd hymn of praise.
text.18: one of the two hath soma seen within it the herdsman with the bone shows forth the other.
text.19: he fain to fight the bull whose horns were sharpened stood fettered in the demons ample region.
text.20: i as a god neer violate the statutes of gods of vasus rudriyas Ādityas.
text.21: these gods have formed me for auspicious vigour unconquered and invincible for ever.
